Contradict fact: The claim that Tim Hortons will close all restaurants on March 30 is contradicted by the statement from a spokesperson for the corporation, who confirmed that Tim Hortons will continue to welcome guests for take-out purchases, drive-thru orders, and delivery.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on two identical articles from websites that have a history of publishing false news. It is also not supported by any official statement or evidence from Tim Hortons.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the closure of smaller food and dining establishments due to social distancing measures applies to Tim Hortons as well, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could have an alternative explanation, such as a misinterpretation or miscommunication of information, which led to the false claim of Tim Hortons closing all restaurants.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it relies on unreliable sources and lacks factual evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration bias in the provided claim.
